title: Testnet Guide
body:
Hi Everyone I hope you're doing well,  Today I am going to help you for Magnety Testnet.

Go to <https://app.magnety.finance/>

When you access to the app you will arrive on this page.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/c1eb867b-dd6b-4897-8efb-75ba41f8082f/Untitled.png)

For the main features like creating and managing a fund, we have to connect a Wallet

## Wallet and Eth Goerli

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/19d13ac2-aa26-4784-a85e-e09287634f3d/Untitled.png)

In order to connect our wallet, we have 2 choices. Connect it to Argent X or Braavos. You can choose the wallet you preferer but in this tutorial I will only use Argent X since It is our favorite wallet.

### How to install Argent X

Argent X is a browser wallet extension that allows you to interact with all Starknet Apps.

Since this is a browser extension we need to install the extension.

âš ï¸ Warning:

Please use Google Chrome-based browser if possible it will facilitate a lot of things later.

For Firefox:

[https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/argent-x/](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/argent-x/)

For Google Chrome / Brave

\[<https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/argent-x/dlcobpjiigpikoobohmabehhmhfoodbb/related>\](<https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/argent-x/dlcobpjiigpikoobohmabehhmhfoodbb>)

When we will open the extension, we will land on the following page:

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/5c44574d-4c28-4298-8d36-17aaf3e43708/Untitled.png)

We will have to create a New wallet and create a new password.

Once you have created your password, You should have this interface

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/e3de793d-7b57-471a-8858-327dee3b061d/Untitled.png)

You have to wait until the Deploy Wallet function is done and congratulations you just finished creating your wallet.

### Get some Some goerli Eth for testnet

As you know when we want to interact with a contract we have to pay some gees in order call a function. Donâ€™t worry getting some testnet Eth is entirely free.

You will have to go to this link:

[https://faucet.goerli.starknet.io/](https://faucet.goerli.starknet.io/)

Enter your argent X address

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/44717f80-0f34-4947-8c32-0ddaeb8c6e54/Untitled.png)

if this work continue and you will receive your token on your Argent Wallet

In case things do not work and you have a blue screen like me:

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/03b5d56a-faf2-4872-98e7-0422a6acda45/Untitled.png)

Donâ€™t worry; it will be a little harder, but you can do it. You will need in addition a Metamask Wallet. In this guide, we will not speak about how to create a Metamask.

We will have to deal with the other solution which implies bridging tokens from L1 to L2. In this case, we will need Google Chrome, thatâ€™s why at the beginning I advise you to use Google Chrome.

[https://faucet.paradigm.xyz/](https://faucet.paradigm.xyz/)

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/2c9c689b-21bb-42a8-9ad1-3e4be3f434f3/Untitled.png)

You have to connect with your Twitter in order to get 0.5 Eth.

In case you donâ€™t have Twitter donâ€™t worry you can use Chainlink Faucet and still get 0.1 eth

[Chainlik faucet](https://faucets.chain.link/goerli)

Once you get some Eth from L1 we have to bridge them In order to take them on Starknet

[https://goerli.starkgate.starknet.io/](https://goerli.starkgate.starknet.io/)

You will have to connect your both Wallet, Metamask and argent X

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/e1890823-c6db-4142-9198-e9af34540e3e/Untitled.png)

You can now transform your Layer 1 goerli token to Starknet token. When Swap doesnâ€™t forget you have to pay the gas fees.

Once you validate the transaction on metamask you will have this little popup showing up

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/bf0bed27-249a-4c19-bfff-82b3ae7ec62f/Untitled.png)

You will have to wait till the metamask transaction is accepted.

âš ï¸ WARNING

Once the Metamask transaction is accepted you will have to wait up to 10 minutes until the fund arrives in Layer 2. Magnety is not in charge of the time the network takes to replace the Fund. Sorry for the time it is very long for everyone.

Once you receive the fund, Congrats the Wallet and test token are done ğŸ¥³

## Create a fund

In order to create a fund we need to click on the monetize button

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/a7afd060-d581-4b58-b56f-b78e07bc1f69/Untitled.png)

We need to configure our fund, you can personalize it is as you want with a name an avatar, a description, some symbol for your fund, and choose the denomination asset (In my case I choose Eth for asset reference)

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/fea32c9b-3047-46d1-8a9c-1a027bee95c7/Untitled.png)

Depending on the asset you choose you can have to do extra Steps

### Alpha Road Finance

Token like Btc (since itâ€™s alpha road Btc) , Astraly, or pool token are not provided directly on Magnety, you have to go on Alpha Road

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/d2cf7503-27aa-460d-a2ff-06b2054198fd/Untitled.png)

If you want to get BTC, Astraly, or TST token, swap some ether for the token you want. When the transaction is accepted, you can go back to Magnety and create your fund.

You have to provide liquidity for all the pairs like (ETH-ASTR, ETH-BTCâ€¦). In order to provide liquidity, you should have both tokens (If I want to invest on ETH-ASTR) I should have some ETH and some ASTR.

Once the transaction is validated go to My liquidity in order to be sure it is working.
It would be best if you had something like that, if itâ€™s the case you can go back on Magnety

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/2a815931-4252-470c-a364-d671166acf1f/Untitled.png)

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/2049f0cf-e4b1-4c06-93f2-53c5febf9abb/Untitled.png)

Once you choose this need to configure your fund accessibility

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/633d9523-102e-46bb-94be-5f87b061a576/Untitled.png)

I decide to make my Fund public, the minimum Investement should be between 0.000001 eth and 20eth. When you mint a piece of my fund,they are lookup at least 3h.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/d8518969-7964-4b40-accc-c6a089d54a3a/Untitled.png)

You can choose with which Defi protocol you want to interact with (note that only Alpha Road is enable for the moment), you can also choose the Asset you want to trade.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/5139f567-e171-4398-aa6a-c3b76de4223b/Untitled.png)

Monetisation is the place where the fund manager will apply his own policies. he can set differents options up to 10% or 20%.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/2c1a8837-84cc-480f-9152-648c84a622d9/Untitled.png)

You need to trade some reference asset, in my case Eth against my fund token (MGTY for me)

You have to decide how much you want to put in your fund and how much token do you want to mint.

You will have to wait until this button show up

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/f009a12f-86ad-4d02-85a6-7f85be80080d/Untitled.png)

As usual you will have to sign the transaction to ArgentX

You will have a nice popup with your fund address on the screen.

Since I am a little bit weird I love to check my transaction status, you can use voayger/address_of_your_contract in order to check the tx status

[https://goerli.voyager.online/](https://goerli.voyager.online/)

Click on the â€œLFGâ€ button in order to go to your vault page.

## Vault page

After deploying your vault you will have access to a beautiful page like this one:

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/c7795469-b795-43bb-8e6a-afab505cf300/Untitled.png)

You can see that we have all the information my fund name, my token fund and all the tags.

Surprise as you can see there is a profile section where you can create your own profile. You will speak about that laterğŸš€

The following graph recap your fund value.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/34104aae-1d64-4c44-bbae-032ea55dc7e1/Untitled.png)

You have two button Invest and manage

### Invest

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/7ea702cf-ee33-4de8-a6e6-fbe76e4694e4/Untitled.png)

You have two options buy or sell parts of your fund.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/ee847aa4-ffd5-4034-934b-b2f7b01e0ce7/Untitled.png)

So as usual just click on the button in order to mint or sell part of your fund and sign the transaction on Argent.

### Manage

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/5b8e9dc3-23ae-4b8f-a6e6-869a39bec4bd/Untitled.png)

Since we have ethereum as a reference token we have to track an another asset for that go to Track window and track btc (Can be done automaticly depends of Testnet release).

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/5870159f-8de7-4c7a-b590-b8cffa15b74e/Untitled.png)

Once the track asset transaction is validated on L2 we need to refresh the page with F5 and now we can see that we have other choice for swaping. Like classic Defi protocol you can add and remove liquidity

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/f4344147-31ac-4013-8f10-5d858319b14b/Untitled.png)

If you want to remove track asset, simply go back and untrack asset.

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/26cf5421-5722-44c0-bc47-4085b4cdddc2/Untitled.png)

## Stacking

In the future, you will be able to stack some Eth in Magnety Stacking Vault

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/a93f903c-d455-4215-89ef-63af77ceb3d0/Untitled.png)

## Profile

On the right, you can see a bar with your profile ( Your profile shouldn't look like mine for the moment). It will display you

You can personalize it as you want to click on the pencil button

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/35ecdffb-f735-47ff-b69f-5b52f02f599e/Untitled.png)

Modify all the elements and in order to save, click on the check button at the top of the page.

You have now tested all the Testnet features for the moment.

Stay tune MarketPlace will come in a few days. ğŸ˜‰

title: Find Your Legal Calling
body:
We're launching a crowdfund for a series of interviews with people about finding their calling. How did they figure out what to do with their lives? What risks did they take, and what setbacks did they suffer? How did they find the courage and inspiration to take the plunge?

Weâ€™re excited to interview [Barbara Fried](https://law.stanford.edu/directory/barbara-fried/), Professor at Stanford Law School. Barbara left a corporate law job to pursue a career in legal academia. She has written extensively in support of a consequentialist approach to public policy and has dedicated most of her free time to voter registration and mobilization efforts since 2018. She is also a published short story writer.

You may be a law school student, figuring out post-graduation plans. Or, youâ€™re a lawyer looking to expand your legal experience in other areas. Or, maybe youâ€™re interested in Barbaraâ€™s public policy work. Whatever the reason, you may want to meet Barbara, ask her questions, and hear the real story of how she applied her legal background to different spheres of work.

## Rewards for Crowdfund Participants

Crowdfund backers will receive $CALL tokens based on their contribution amounts. Top $CALL holders have a chance to meet Barbara and other interviewees. Weâ€™re also interviewing [Andrew Chau](https://www.instagram.com/chaumeleon/), Co-founder ofÂ [Boba Guys](https://www.bobaguys.com/).

Top $CALL holders can meet and engage with interviewees, as follows:

* Alpha Tier (at least 250 $CALL, 0.25 ETH+; \~$250 USD): Top 3 $CALL holders participate in a live virtual conversation with both Andrew and Barbara\*
* Beta Tier (at least 50 $CALL, 0.05 ETH+; \~$50 USD): Top 5 $CALL holders participate live in an interview and ask questions\*
* Gamma Tier (at least 25 $CALL, 0.025 ETH+ \~$25 USD): $CALL holders can submit suggested questions for interviews\*

We're doing something a bit different with our crowdfund. Once an interview is published, $CALL holders can share the articles with friends. If those friends read an article, we will airdrop the referring $CALL holder additional $CALL. As they accumulate $CALL, they have an opportunity to move up into the Alpha, Beta, or Gamma Tiers to participate in the interviews. We want to provide everyone, regardless of financial means, the opportunity to engage with the interviewees.

Our hope is that backers will organically be incentivized to share (and acquire more tokens) because they inherently like the project, are curious about what it takes to find their calling, and want to interact with the interviewees. Please note that in order to receive additional $CALL from sharing, you will need to have participated in the initial crowdfund, even if only for a teeny tiny fraction of ETH.

## How to Participate

1. Contribute to the crowdfund.
2. Once you contribute, send us both your public wallet address and contact (email address or Twitter handle). You can either email us ([web3callproject@gmail.com](http://mailto:web3callproject@gmail.com/)) or Twitter direct message (@web3callproject). If you are a top $CALL holder, we will email or direct message you the interview meeting dial-in details.
3. Once interviews are published, share with others who will enjoy the interview. If they read, we will airdrop you additional $CALL tokens for each referral (the number of tokens airdropped will be calculated as described in the next section below). To share an interview, we will send you a unique referral URL to the contact details you provide.

[crowdfund://0x7313328021Ac92AA4067c47e5995454d6505F184?features=overview,backers](crowdfund://0x7313328021Ac92AA4067c47e5995454d6505F184?features=overview,backers)

## Why Weâ€™re Doing This Project: Finding Our Calling

Finding and pursuing a calling typically isn't something that just happens. Sometimes, what's holding people back is comfort. It's hard to leave a well-paying or stable job even if the day-to-day of the work isn't something you particularly enjoy. After all, pursuing a passion can be risky, tough, and time-consuming. Other times, it's society. Especially among coastal elites, societal pressure (e.g., prestige) makes certain jobs optically appealing and substantively empty. ## Crowdfund Timeline, Details, and Rules

We will close the crowdfund on June 30, and interviews will happen once a month over the next three months (i.e., July, August, and September). In October, we will host a virtual panel with all interviewees.

We will publish all interviews to the general public. If we raise more than our 3 ETH goal, we will interview one new person for each additional ETH raised beyond the goal.

![$CALL Crowdfund Timeline](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2FC7XK6EP3D4JuEBTFkBY.png?height=1280&width=3086&&&&&&&&size=large)

We structured the crowdfund so that participants want $CALL tokens to meet interviewees; not for financial investment.Â We established the alpha, beta, and gamma tiers in $CALL amounts commensurate with interview participation. We implemented the interview sharing mechanism so that people cannot simply buy their way in to meet interviewees. You may wonder: Why, then, do people need to purchase $CALL tokens at all? We believe that paying for a service â€” in this case, the chance to participate in an interview â€” is the strongest signal of its value and how much itâ€™s worth. To ensure oneâ€™s financial situation does not preclude crowdfund participation, weâ€™ve enabled people to give as little as one penny. Although, they may need to put more effort in sharing if they want enough $CALL tokens to meet the interviewees.

How are we testing the hypotheses here? A few mechanics:

* (1) After each interview, we will publish the interview transcript both on Mirror and on Medium. Using Google Analytics, we'll track engagement on the platform (i.e., the amount of impressions and time spent reading or listening to the interviews). Our bet is that the organic sharing via the Web3 community will heavily overpower algorithmic distribution.
* (2) More importantly, to incentivize organic sharing among those who care about these interviews and want to participate in them, we will be giving additional tokens to crowdfund backers who share the interview with others. The technical infrastructure for this doesn't exist yet, so we're hacking something together (admittedly with some Web 2.0 tracking). Specifically, we are using Google Analytics referral codes to see who is helping others discover relevant content.
* (3) If you share an interview with others and they read an interview, we will manually airdrop $CALL into your public wallet. As a default, each share will earn the sharer 5 $CALL. However, recall that 20% of the total $CALL supply is reserved for airdrops for each interview. If the 20% limit is reached for a particular interview, the referral may be worth less $CALL. In other words, each share will be worth the minimum of 5 $CALLÂ *or*Â the allocated token supply divided by the number of referrals. For instance, suppose that 20% of the $CALL pool is 100 $CALL. If an interview is shared 50 times, then each share will be worth 2 $CALL. However, if an interview is shared only 5 times, then each share will be worth 5 $CALL. This dynamic $CALL pricing is a distinguishing token attribute; it incentivizes content curation. Because $CALL tokens are worth less if interviews are more widely shared, people are incentivized to share with a smaller subset of people who are truly interested in the interviews. This unique token attribute is another reason we use Web3 tokens for this project.

70% of $CALL tokens will be retained in a pool, and 30% will be distributed to crowdfund backers. The 70% of $CALL tokens in reserve will be allocated as follows:

* 20% of $CALL tokens will be airdropped to those who share the first interview.
* 20% of $CALL tokens will be airdropped to those who share the second interview.
* 20% of $CALL tokens will be airdropped to those who share the third interview.
* 10% of $CALL tokens will be retained by Chris and Andy.

The crowdfund proceeds will be distributed to interviewees (50%), Chris (25%), and Andy (25%). Interviewees may choose to donate their proceeds to a non-profit charity of their choice.

\*Interview participants and question submissions will need to abide by community standards:

* Interview participants will not be anonymous; they will need to turn on their video to participate in Zoom interviews. We will only publish the audio; we will not publish the visual portion of the interviews.
* We forbid any questions or comments that are hateful, violent, inflammatory, sexually explicit, discriminatory, political, or personal attacks.
* We expect everyone to participate with mutual respect, dignity, and professionalism. We will immediately exclude any participants who do not act in accordance with these standards.

title: Testnet Guide
body:
Hi Everyone I hope you're doing well,  Today I am going to help you for Magnety Testnet.

Go to <https://app.magnety.finance/>

When you access to the app you will arrive on this page.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/356GHkjad70gN8dlaFb23.png?height=937&width=1910)

For the main features like creating and managing a fund, we have to connect a Wallet

## Wallet and Eth Goerli

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uXatz-Uu_gp64Mm-3y3PB.png?height=202&width=501)

In order to connect our wallet, we have 2 choices. Connect it to Argent X or Braavos. You can choose the wallet you preferer but in this tutorial I will only use Argent X since It is our favorite wallet.

### How to install Argent X

Argent X is a browser wallet extension that allows you to interact with all Starknet Apps.

Since this is a browser extension we need to install the extension.

âš ï¸ Warning:

Please use Google Chrome-based browser if possible it will facilitate a lot of things later.

For Firefox:

[https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/argent-x/](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/argent-x/)

For Google Chrome / Brave

\[<https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/argent-x/dlcobpjiigpikoobohmabehhmhfoodbb/related>\](<https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/argent-x/dlcobpjiigpikoobohmabehhmhfoodbb>)

When we will open the extension, we will land on the following page:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Wh65EbwzPkLfttYQEfgAA.png?height=592&width=361)

We will have to create a New wallet and create a new password.

Once you have created your password, You should have this interface

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KF2bEtbqQ-N05d3R3zF04.png?height=595&width=354)

You have to wait until the Deploy Wallet function is done and congratulations you just finished creating your wallet.

### Get some Some goerli Eth for testnet

As you know when we want to interact with a contract we have to pay some gees in order call a function. Donâ€™t worry getting some testnet Eth is entirely free.

You will have to go to this link:

[https://faucet.goerli.starknet.io/](https://faucet.goerli.starknet.io/)

Enter your argent X address

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Cpa4plfKwwODZ9QyUPwSB.png?height=909&width=1772)

if this work continue and you will receive your token on your Argent Wallet

In case things do not work and you have a blue screen like me:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mU-D5pXF40lnZgHzpep05.png?height=571&width=1276)

Donâ€™t worry; it will be a little harder, but you can do it. You will need in addition a Metamask Wallet. In this guide, we will not speak about how to create a Metamask.

We will have to deal with the other solution which implies bridging tokens from L1 to L2. In this case, we will need Google Chrome, thatâ€™s why at the beginning I advise you to use Google Chrome.

[https://faucet.paradigm.xyz/](https://faucet.paradigm.xyz/)

![Untitled](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/secure.notion-static.com/2c9c689b-21bb-42a8-9ad1-3e4be3f434f3/Untitled.png)

You have to connect with your Twitter in order to get 0.5 Eth.

In case you donâ€™t have Twitter donâ€™t worry you can use Chainlink Faucet and still get 0.1 eth

[Chainlik faucet](https://faucets.chain.link/goerli)

Once you get some Eth from L1 we have to bridge them In order to take them on Starknet

[https://goerli.starkgate.starknet.io/](https://goerli.starkgate.starknet.io/)

You will have to connect your both Wallet, Metamask and argent X

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0kXb26kXt2bBz4YYblOot.png?height=946&width=1917)

You can now transform your Layer 1 goerli token to Starknet token. When Swap doesnâ€™t forget you have to pay the gas fees.

Once you validate the transaction on metamask you will have this little popup showing up

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RdzOqPlxhTedw-ZJx011D.png?height=325&width=635)

You will have to wait till the metamask transaction is accepted.

âš ï¸ WARNING

Once the Metamask transaction is accepted you will have to wait up to 10 minutes until the fund arrives in Layer 2. Magnety is not in charge of the time the network takes to replace the Fund. Sorry for the time it is very long for everyone.

Once you receive the fund, Congrats the Wallet and test token are done ğŸ¥³

## Create a fund

In order to create a fund we need to click on the monetize button

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZO9yQpxxIy5_MXntKNMMd.png?height=365&width=640)

We need to configure our fund, you can personalize it is as you want with a name an avatar, a description, some symbol for your fund, and choose the denomination asset (In my case I choose Eth for asset reference)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rmeK3qmzRSRT4NJHp5VQI.png?height=648&width=1383)

Depending on the asset you choose you can have to do extra Steps

### Alpha Road Finance

Token like Btc (since itâ€™s alpha road Btc) , Astraly, or pool token are not provided directly on Magnety, you have to go on Alpha Road

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9nl28bbCqWjCYJ8h8hzjs.png?height=553&width=1189)

If you want to get BTC, Astraly, or TST token, swap some ether for the token you want. When the transaction is accepted, you can go back to Magnety and create your fund.

You have to provide liquidity for all the pairs like (ETH-ASTR, ETH-BTCâ€¦). In order to provide liquidity, you should have both tokens (If I want to invest on ETH-ASTR) I should have some ETH and some ASTR.

Once the transaction is validated go to My liquidity in order to be sure it is working. It would be best if you had something like that, if itâ€™s the case you can go back on Magnety

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/hQpEx7-JP2FreKDbDAz6h.png?height=566&width=1189)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/scs-ofowUgFesDf4o12gs.png?height=550&width=1261)

Once you choose this need to configure your fund accessibility

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1IJ92vHHGL6aIMaji2Mge.png?height=285&width=1343)

I decide to make my Fund public, the minimum Investement should be between 0.000001 eth and 20eth. When you mint a piece of my fund,they are lookup at least 3h.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CS16yCa4gAF8WMldNnk3k.png?height=392&width=1312)

You can choose with which Defi protocol you want to interact with (note that only Alpha Road is enable for the moment), you can also choose the Asset you want to trade.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/imrO0TOIm7aCDa4PrOdOg.png?height=317&width=1254)

Monetisation is the place where the fund manager will apply his own policies. he can set differents options up to 10% or 20%.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9CmcLxxkDDKO8ogulxHys.png?height=387&width=1232)

You need to trade some reference asset, in my case Eth against my fund token (MGTY for me)

You have to decide how much you want to put in your fund and how much token do you want to mint.

You will have to wait until this button show up

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1ewfCS1-csYpVLYLpkLIz.png?height=77&width=197)

As usual you will have to sign the transaction to ArgentX

You will have a nice popup with your fund address on the screen.

Since I am a little bit weird I love to check my transaction status, you can use voayger/address_of_your_contract in order to check the tx status

[https://goerli.voyager.online/](https://goerli.voyager.online/)

Click on the â€œLFGâ€ button in order to go to your vault page.

## Vault page

After deploying your vault you will have access to a beautiful page like this one:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jmEFhWmws7T9omHsGoyoN.png?height=415&width=1544)

You can see that we have all the information my fund name, my token fund and all the tags.

Surprise as you can see there is a profile section where you can create your own profile. You will speak about that laterğŸš€

The following graph recap your fund value.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lsh1xvlwaxeRdWBpQEUaM.png?height=712&width=1292)

You have two button Invest and manage

### Invest

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/YXvBcIaIZQqX-Yc4KMviV.png?height=459&width=601)

You have two options buy or sell parts of your fund.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7DygUwC_yd_vT2jM2aT1y.png?height=389&width=709)

So as usual just click on the button in order to mint or sell part of your fund and sign the transaction on Argent.

### Manage

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qTK2LUKXCQi2F72895yyM.png?height=670&width=1373)

Since we have ethereum as a reference token we have to track an another asset for that go to Track window and track btc (Can be done automaticly depends of Testnet release).

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uOBLW_nLG2cyfGv6i9SAo.png?height=678&width=1295)

Once the track asset transaction is validated on L2 we need to refresh the page with F5 and now we can see that we have other choice for swaping. Like classic Defi protocol you can add and remove liquidity

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/shHOGO39Vcly3X4Y8f881.png?height=728&width=1370)

If you want to remove track asset, simply go back and untrack asset.

## 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iqrvHSh--Tvf1nDauNjFq.png?height=683&width=1256)

## Stacking

In the future, you will be able to stack some Eth in Magnety Stacking Vault

## 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xFCcO9bR1s2tDiMr2oPbs.png?height=875&width=1627)

## Profile

On the right, you can see a bar with your profile ( Your profile shouldn't look like mine for the moment). It will display you

You can personalize it as you want to click on the pencil button

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iDDE_or8D6oq9pVq2J64W.png?height=882&width=1623)

Modify all the elements and in order to save, click on the check button at the top of the page.

You have now tested all the Testnet features for the moment.

Stay tune MarketPlace will come in a few days. ğŸ˜‰

title: Google gives Chromebooks more ways to connect with other devices.
body:
## Google announced Chrome 103 on Thursday, making it easier to share photos from Android to your Chromebook. The company also said an update that will simplify Bluetooth connections is on the way.

As detailed in a [blog post](https://blog.google/products/chromebooks/better-with-other-devices/) byÂ Alexander Kuscher, director of Chrome OS Software at Google, the update builds on the Phone Hub app released to Chrome OS last year. It works with smartphones running Android 5.1 and later and lets you view the phone's text messages and battery life and bring over tabs from your mobile Chrome browser to your Chromebook's browser.

In Chrome 103, photos you take on your Android Phone will automatically show up in the Phone Hub under a new "Recent photos" section.

![Chrome OS Phone Hub app shows an Android phone's recent photos.](https://cdn.arstechnica.net/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/recent-photos-in-phone-hub.jpg)

You can then download the images to save to your Chromebook so you can edit them, email them, or do anything else you'd prefer to do on a computer instead of a phone.

Google is also updating its Nearby Share feature in Chrome 103. Nearby Share uses Bluetooth Low Energy, WebRTC, or peer-to-peer Wi-Fi to share files over the air between Chromebooks and Android phones. Chrome 103 gives you the ability to connect a Chromebook to a saved Wi-Fi network. The next time a new Chromebook connects to your network, you won't have to find your Wi-Fi password to set it up if your Android phone is already connected.

The process described by Kuscher seems simple enough. On an Android phone, you just go to the Wi-Fi network, hit Share, then tap a "Nearby" tile under a QR code. Afterward, you'll be able to see the Chromebook and can connect it to the Wi-Fi network, the blog said.

Advertisement

![Connecting a Chromebook to Wi-Fi without using a password.](https://cdn.arstechnica.net/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/nearby-share.jpg)

"Nearby Share will deliver the Wi-Fi credentials (as in the network name and password), and the Chromebook will automatically connect to the Wi-Fi. And, of course, it will also save for the next time the Chromebook needs to use that Wi-Fi network,"Â Kuscher explained.

Kuscher also said that Chrome 103 will get a Fast Pair Bluetooth update "later this summer." The feature should allow you to connect Bluetooth devices, like headphones, without having to figure out which button to press on the product or do anything in the Chromebook settings other than turning Bluetooth on.

"Just turn on your Chromebookâ€™s Bluetooth, and it will automatically detect when a new pair of Bluetooth headphones are on, are nearby, and are ready to be set up. A pop-up notification will appear, and with one tap, your new accessory is connected and ready to go," Kuscher wrote. "No more digging through settings or struggling to figure out the right button to press to pair your headphones."

This feature would differ from similar technologies like Windows Swift Pair, which presents a pop-up on the PC when it senses a Bluetooth device, but only if the wireless device is in its pairing mode.

Kuscher said the feature will work with "hundreds of different headphone models," including, not surprisingly, Google's Pixel Buds. Kuscher didn't specify which models of the Pixels Buds would support the feature but shared an image of the $99 [Pixel Buds A-series](https://store.google.com/product/pixel_buds_a_series?hl=en-US) that came out in June 2021.

title: What's a 'Good' Explanation?
body:
## Look at your surroundings.

Now, explain how you ended up here.

Did your answer include the creation of existence, such as The Big Bang? If not, your answer is incomplete.

### Existence

Donâ€™t be hard on yourself. Your explanation did not need to be 100% complete to suffice. This prompt is typically interpreted as a request for the most immediate and significant reasons for being here, such as: â€œI fell off my bike and broke my arm, so now I am in the ERâ€. For obvious reasons, it is impractical to describe The Big Bang and then every sequential moment that led to you falling off your bike. Nonetheless, letâ€™s examine the reasons: (1) ainâ€™t nobody got time for that. (2) any attempt at a complete explanation would be riddled with assumptions and inaccuracies. Nobody has observed every moment in spacetime, nor possesses the memory and processing capability to completely understand these events. The main point here is that there is a *reason for being* (not to be confused with purpose). The reason that â€˜youâ€™ exist is because your dadâ€™s sperm fertilized your momâ€™s egg. Somewhere along the way, â€˜youâ€™ came into existence. However, the answer to the question â€œWhy did you fall off your bike?â€ requires an infinitely precise answer in order to be 100% accurate (we obviously do not care about 100% accuracy in all cases, nor is 100% accuracy attainable). This is what we will explore in this post.

### Elements of the Mind

Okay, we do not care about The Big Bang when examining your current position in life. Instead, letâ€™s view the most important part of reality -- your lifetime -- because everyone is the hero of their own story.

Letâ€™s begin at the moment in which â€œyouâ€ obtain consciousness\* (ironically, a moment that nobody can remember). Upon accessing reality for the first time, â€œyouâ€ are immediately introduced to the **cause and effect protocol** of the universe, become aware of â€œyourâ€ existence (â€˜consciousnessâ€™), as well as develop an awareness of â€˜thoughtsâ€™ and a procedure of thoughts (â€˜thinkingâ€™), and eventually learn from the environment (â€˜intelligenceâ€™, â€˜cognitionâ€™, or as I like to say, â€˜an ability to connect the dotsâ€™). In this case, the dots are bits of observed data (â€˜informationâ€™) interpreted as truth (â€˜knowledgeâ€™), which we store in our â€˜memoryâ€™. The connections are a model that describes a functional i/o relation between bits (â€˜understandingâ€™). Putting this all together, â€œweâ€ exist as a conscious, intelligent agent of reality perceiving a sequence of moments (â€˜experienceâ€™) which we call life. It is almost as if reality is a Turing-Complete system (a BIG assumption) and our brains are a Turing Machine (another BIG assumption). The one thing missing in the Turing analogy is our â€˜imaginationâ€™ -- the power to â€œsee the unseenâ€. The reason that imagination is missing is because it is inconsistent with a Turing Machine, and thus makes humans extra interesting. The brain (our 'â€œinterpretation engineâ€) is unique and not well understood. We are also skipping the sub-conscious element of this model for now â€¦ but will definitely discuss it later.

### Trapped In The Present

The reason that we care about history is because we can learn things that may help us in the future. We start to learn the code of reality from personal observations. Then, we learn to communicate with others, trade ideas and inspiration with them, and trust their experiences and historical accounts of reality\*\**.* After all, we physically cannot observe *everything* ourselves. Your first conscious moment is different from my first moment, and our experiences may never overlap in any meaningful way (disregarding butterfly effects for now). We cannot recount the past with 100% certainty, especially events that we did not personally observe (and even when we do have an experience â€¦ our memory can still be fuzzy). In other words, you should keep the grain of salt in your lens. There are also complex mechanisms that influence our perception (such as assumptions, cognitive bias, motivation, feelings, emotions, and biology) of which we may not be aware in the moment (not to mention the physical limitations of our human senses). Perspective is gained with an account of bias. The famous motto from The Royal Society is pertinent here -- *Nullius in Verba* -- â€œtake nobodyâ€™s word for itâ€.

![A crude example of well-intentioned (perhaps) yet biased hearsay](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2dSC4WSKaPSXEgp5J1L9A.png?height=1945&width=2085)

A historical account is more reputable when there is evidence to corroborate itâ€™s truth. The most influential evidence garners mass consensus of its implication (a flawed mechanism for finding truth â€¦ though it does provide a clue). There is a well known saying â€œwisdom of the crowdâ€. There is also a lesser known but equally as important saying â€œfatality of the mobâ€. Consensus provides a signal on social dynamics more than anything. The objective of consensus is to win a majority, which is all about compromise\*\*\*, not truth-seeking. There is another common phrase, â€œhistory is written by the winnersâ€, which is not an entirely true statement in its literal translation but is an attempt to describe the common biases in historical accounting. The history textbooks are missing many individual accounts, particularly on the loserâ€™s side. This is not all the publisherâ€™s fault because there are typically less of the losers around after a significant historical event like war, but the missing context makes the book sensitive to a combination of conformity, misattribution, and survivorship bias.

![Infinitism or The Absence of Evidence vs. Evidence of Absence Problem -- The Ultimate Burden Of Proof](http://www.phdcomics.com/comics/archive/phd070309s.gif)

Evidence is built through discovery -- a gain of information which improves our understanding of the circumstances which produced the evidence. It is still up to humans to deduce valid conclusions from discoveries. We commonly mistake evidence as proof. Circumstantial evidence does not have the power to prove on its own. Rather, it can indicate the likelihood of a particular eventsâ€™ existence, but not accurately until we drop it into context. A proper investigation entails observing each instance of history and each piece of evidence as independent from each other and then imagining the logical sequence of events to form dependencies, hence the phrase â€œdrawing a conclusionâ€. Every piece of evidence or historical account has a level of faith associated with it (and we usually realize overconfidence). For example, the discovery of fossils indicates the existence of large, now-extinct beings. And we can even imagine what they looked like! However, the fossils and present-day graphical renderings do not prove dinosaursâ€™ existence. The evidence simply gives us a level of confidence. A different explanation for the existence of fossils could be that a scientist synthesized fossil materials in a lab and buried them to eventually claim fame once he/she later 'discovers' them and proposes a breakthrough theory of dinosaurs. However, there are sound reasons that easily disprove this explanation, namely, there is no evidence of a scientist or lab in 1677 (when Robert Plot found the first fossil) that had the capability to synthesize an organic material that could resemble the form of a fossil.

![The Gettier Problem (philosophy), GÃ¶delâ€™s Incompleteness Theorems (math), and Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle (science)Â all arrive at the same idea from different disciplines -- proof requires complete information and infinite precision. Conjecture is imminent (we settle for "beyond a reasonable doubt" in court.)](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/proof.png)

Evidence is an empirical starting point. It exists in context. A thorough assessment of evidence addresses as much context as possible. At the same time, there will always be missing context, so we will never have a totally complete or perfectly accurate history. I call this *The* *Theory of Relative History*.

### Explanations

I once concluded that everything can be explained, so the world must be deterministic. I arrived at this conclusion after reading *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.amazon.com/Beginning-Infinity-Explanations-Transform-World/dp/0143121359)* by David Deutsch. I highly recommend reading it. In fact, it was the inspiration for this blog (if you donâ€™t read books, then at least listen to Naval Ravikantâ€™s *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEmJIA0pEf0)* podcast series with Brett Hall breaking down the book). The big takeaway from the book is that omniscience is not required to have â€˜creativityâ€™ -- an ability to create new â€œthingsâ€. You do not need to know absolutely every fact that exists in order to understand everything that can be understood. Reality is most accurately described using good explanations, and there is an explanation for everything. The building blocks of explanations are **[First Principles](https://fs.blog/first-principles/#_ftn11)** -- namely the foundations of science (Relativity, Quantum, Evolution, Information, Computing, etc.) -- and the fuel is imagination.

> *â€œWhat I cannot create, I do not understandâ€*
>
> \-- Richard Feynman

Science is an error-correcting machine. It disproves explanations and forms better ones. You will find that the most impactful explanations require intense imagination because they describe â€˜the seenâ€™ in terms of â€˜the unseenâ€™. In other words, they describe things that cannot be observed. Unseen phenomena can be measured with special equipment, but we just observe the measurement readings on the equipment. For example, we can measure the temperature of an atomâ€™s nucleus, but we cannot observe the movement of quarks which are the cause (we think) of the temperature reading that we observe. An explanation is not an explanation unless it is testable, falsifiable, and precisely describes a significant mechanism of change (cause and effect). It is our best guess. In this way, even good explanations are at risk of being inaccurate. This is okay because this is how we create new knowledge. A good explanation is our best understanding, our best description for how something works, at any given time. It is like the scientific method on steroids. A good explanation provides reasons and digs deep. It asks questions to get to the root. Try the **5 Whyâ€™s method** to improve the accuracy of an explanation.

> *â€œScience is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.â€*
>
> â€” Carl Sagan

As you can see from the bike example at the beginning, an explanation does not need to be entirely complete in order to be valuable because intelligent beings (humans) can identify patterns and make inferences. Again, a partially true, incomplete explanation can be sufficient if we only care about a certain level of accuracy. An explanation is measured by its explanatory power -- the degree to which an explanation accomplishes an objective. The objective can be to accurately describe Truth. Explanations have degrees of completeness based on the amount of information present in them\*\*\*\*. A thorough explanation leaves little to chance. A complete explanation leaves nothing to chance. The pinnacle of explanations is a perfect explanation -- 100% complete and 100% accurate. The ultimate explanation, a *Theory of Everything*, would be perfect. Many people have tried to find this explanation, such as Michio Kaku's *[The God Equation](https://www.amazon.com/God-Equation-Quest-Theory-Everything/dp/0385542747)* (I have not read yet), but none have succeeded.

The jury is still out on if a perfect explanation exists.

### Truth

Our initial guess for how knowledge exists is known as the â€˜justified true beliefâ€™ theory of knowledge. This theory says that knowledge is about justifying your beliefs as true. It then goes on to say that if you accomplish this, then your belief is knowledge. This a misconception because there is no logical way to prove any bit of knowledge as Truth (with a capital â€˜Tâ€™). One can provide evidence, but this is not proof. If an explanation prevails against attempts to disprove it, then it is consistent with reality and is probably considered useful. Yet, we can never know with 100% certainty that the explanation accurately describes a fundamental Truth (a â€œlawâ€ of nature\*\*\*\*\*) because there is always a chance that we discover new knowledge debunking that explanation. Then, we simply come up with a better explanation.

The first step to finding truth is to develop a theory of knowledge (epistemology). I subscribe to the theory that knowledge is an interpretation of information that is accepted as truth and can be measured for accuracy and significance. This implies knowledge is subjective i.e. your truth may not be my truth.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xwFu_2fyTN7kfq6Mi8bBH.png?height=792&width=1561)

In the end, knowledge is still just an assumption. Humans seek highly objective knowledge because we get rewarded with better predictions. Nassim Taleb describes a concept of *knowledge iteration* in his *[Incerto](https://www.amazon.com/Incerto-Deluxe-Randomness-Procrustes-Antifragile/dp/198481981X)* (my favorite is *[The Black Swan](https://www.amazon.com/Black-Swan-Impact-Improbable-Incerto/dp/1400063515/ref=asc_df_1400063515/?tag=hyprod-20&linkCode=df0&hvadid=312106851030&hvpos=&hvnetw=g&hvrand=11165397501409576070&hvpone=&hvptwo=&hvqmt=&hvdev=c&hvdvcmdl=&hvlocint=&hvlocphy=9010943&hvtargid=pla-330161967766&psc=1)*). There are things that we simply do not know about reality.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kWP9k4Mb0aJLmmm6JXgSD.png?height=697&width=1114)

Explanations can retrospectively describe causation and also fuel predictions -â†’ which builds knowledge -â†’ which inspires imagination -â†’ which creates explanations. These â€˜creationsâ€™ bring a truth into existence that did not exist before (or at least did not exist to â€˜youâ€™). It is quite liberating when you realize that explanations are created with imagination, so in theory, you can understand anything! Regardless of whether or not information is infinite\*\*\*\*\*\*, knowledge is not scarce. It is the product of intelligence and imagination and is stored in memory. It reveals unknown unknowns. We don't know for sure what will effect us, kill us, or save us. It may not be real today.

Keep in mind, reality is unbiased. It is Truth. It just is\*\*\*\*\*\*\*. It is the purest form of objectivity (no interpretation necessary). Frankly, reality does not care about you (or anything). Reality is left to humans for interpretation. The most useful application of this realization is to practice acceptance because the world is not out to get you. At the same time, we can effect change in our lives. For every effect, there is a cause\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*. For every output, there is an input. You may notice the continuity of this universal model. But what happens when there is a discontinuity in the model? And what does a gap represent?

### Randomness

The answer is randomness -- an absence of information. This is where we can assign probabilities rather than determinations of the future. The important thing here is that reality is not intrinsically random or uncertain â€¦ with one theoretical exception. The only proposed natural randomness in the universe is the phenomena described by quantum mechanics -- an explanation for how matter and energy behaves as spacetime approaches zero. Even in quantum, we have some predictive ability of the probability distribution of subatomic particles in spacetime. This gets more interesting if you consider quantum randomness in a multiplicative series of moments. As you can see, each sequential moment gets increasingly difficult to predict and eventually the complexity explodes, leading most scientists to chaos theory and the multiverse\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*.

All other probability is subject to a knowledge base. This means that any likelihood which we attributed to an eventâ€™s existence is a function of our ignorance. When humans say â€œI am uncertainâ€, we are admitting that we do not know a critical piece of information that would make the Truth apparent. We can reduce uncertainty and increase the accuracy of our predictions by reducing knowledge gaps (not to be confused with information gaps). Here are two ways to reduce knowledge gaps and improve predictability:

1\.) empirical methods -- inducing a hypothesis from experience.

2\.) explanatory methods -- deducing a cause and effect relation from imagination.

These methods are most powerful when deployed in tandem.

Empirical methods infer an independent factor (causal inference) from observations or experimental results (statistics). This is useful to identify information gaps. You can gain (uncover) information by changing the conditions (i.e. varying the independent variable to see the change in the dependent variable). Hereâ€™s a hint, when correlations between events approach 100%, you may getting closer to a causal relationship (though there still may be â€˜Hiddenâ€™ variables\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* which are the actual root cause). However, correlation is not causation\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* â€¦. so â€¦ how do you know if the measured response in the â€˜effect variableâ€™ was the result of varying the â€˜cause variableâ€™ or if the independent factors are truly independent themselves? Enter explanations.

This is how explanatory methods save the day. Explanations can generate knowledge from information not apparent in the observations or statistics. An explanation can implicate an unknown factor as the root cause.

title: What's a 'Good' Explanation?
body:
## Look at your surroundings.

Now, explain how you ended up here.

Did your answer include the creation of existence, such as The Big Bang? If not, your answer is incomplete.

### Existence

Donâ€™t be hard on yourself. Your explanation did not need to be 100% complete to suffice. This prompt is typically interpreted as a request for the most immediate and significant reasons for being here, such as: â€œI fell off my bike and broke my arm, so now I am in the ERâ€. For obvious reasons, it is impractical to describe The Big Bang and then every sequential moment that led to you falling off your bike. Nonetheless, letâ€™s examine the reasons: (1) ainâ€™t nobody got time for that. (2) any attempt at a complete explanation would be riddled with assumptions and inaccuracies. Nobody has observed every moment in spacetime, nor possesses the memory and processing capability to completely understand these events. The main point here is that there is a *reason for being* (not to be confused with purpose). The reason that â€˜youâ€™ exist is because your dadâ€™s sperm fertilized your momâ€™s egg. Somewhere along the way, â€˜youâ€™ came into existence. However, the answer to the question â€œWhy did you fall off your bike?â€ requires an infinitely precise answer in order to be 100% accurate (we obviously do not care about 100% accuracy in all cases, nor is 100% accuracy attainable). This is what we will explore in this post.

### Elements of the Mind

Okay, we do not care about The Big Bang when examining your current position in life. Instead, letâ€™s view the most important part of reality -- your lifetime -- because everyone is the hero of their own story.

Letâ€™s begin at the moment in which â€œyouâ€ obtain consciousness\* (ironically, a moment that nobody can remember). Upon accessing reality for the first time, â€œyouâ€ are immediately introduced to the **cause and effect protocol** of the universe, become aware of â€œyourâ€ existence (â€˜consciousnessâ€™), as well as develop an awareness of â€˜thoughtsâ€™ and a procedure of thoughts (â€˜thinkingâ€™), and eventually learn from the environment (â€˜intelligenceâ€™, â€˜cognitionâ€™, or as I like to say, â€˜an ability to connect the dotsâ€™). In this case, the dots are bits of observed data (â€˜informationâ€™) interpreted as truth (â€˜knowledgeâ€™), which we store in our â€˜memoryâ€™. The connections are a model that describes a functional i/o relation between bits (â€˜understandingâ€™). Putting this all together, â€œweâ€ exist as a conscious, intelligent agent of reality perceiving a sequence of moments (â€˜experienceâ€™) which we call life. It is almost as if reality is a Turing-Complete system (a BIG assumption) and our brains are a Turing Machine (another BIG assumption). The one thing missing in the Turing analogy is our â€˜imaginationâ€™ -- the power to â€œsee the unseenâ€. The reason that imagination is missing is because it is inconsistent with a Turing Machine, and thus makes humans extra interesting. The brain (our 'â€œinterpretation engineâ€) is unique and not well understood. We are also skipping the sub-conscious element of this model for now â€¦ but will definitely discuss it later.

### Trapped In The Present

The reason that we care about history is because we can learn things that may help us in the future. We start to learn the code of reality from personal observations. Then, we learn to communicate with others, trade ideas and inspiration with them, and trust their experiences and historical accounts of reality\*\**.* After all, we physically cannot observe *everything* ourselves. Your first conscious moment is different from my first moment, and our experiences may never overlap in any meaningful way (disregarding butterfly effects for now). We cannot recount the past with 100% certainty, especially events that we did not personally observe (and even when we do have an experience â€¦ our memory can still be fuzzy). In other words, you should keep the grain of salt in your lens. There are also complex mechanisms that influence our perception (such as assumptions, cognitive bias, motivation, feelings, emotions, and biology) of which we may not be aware in the moment (not to mention the physical limitations of our human senses). Perspective is gained with an account of bias. The famous motto from The Royal Society is pertinent here -- *Nullius in Verba* -- â€œtake nobodyâ€™s word for itâ€.

![A crude example of well-intentioned (perhaps) yet biased hearsay](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2dSC4WSKaPSXEgp5J1L9A.png?height=1945&width=2085)

A historical account is more reputable when there is evidence to corroborate itâ€™s truth. The most influential evidence garners mass consensus of its implication (a flawed mechanism for finding truth â€¦ though it does provide a clue). There is a well known saying â€œwisdom of the crowdâ€. There is also a lesser known but equally as important saying â€œfatality of the mobâ€. Consensus provides a signal on social dynamics more than anything. The objective of consensus is to win a majority, which is all about compromise\*\*\*, not truth-seeking. There is another common phrase, â€œhistory is written by the winnersâ€, which is not an entirely true statement in its literal translation but is an attempt to describe the common biases in historical accounting. The history textbooks are missing many individual accounts, particularly on the loserâ€™s side. This is not all the publisherâ€™s fault because there are typically less of the losers around after a significant historical event like war, but the missing context makes the book sensitive to a combination of conformity, misattribution, and survivorship bias.

![Infinitism or The Absence of Evidence vs. Evidence of Absence Problem -- The Ultimate Burden Of Proof](http://www.phdcomics.com/comics/archive/phd070309s.gif)

Evidence is built through discovery -- a gain of information which improves our understanding of the circumstances which produced the evidence. It is still up to humans to deduce valid conclusions from discoveries. We commonly mistake evidence as proof. Circumstantial evidence does not have the power to prove on its own. Rather, it can indicate the likelihood of a particular eventsâ€™ existence, but not accurately until we drop it into context. A proper investigation entails observing each instance of history and each piece of evidence as independent from each other and then imagining the logical sequence of events to form dependencies, hence the phrase â€œdrawing a conclusionâ€. Every piece of evidence or historical account has a level of faith associated with it (and we usually realize overconfidence). For example, the discovery of fossils indicates the existence of large, now-extinct beings. And we can even imagine what they looked like! However, the fossils and present-day graphical renderings do not prove dinosaursâ€™ existence. The evidence simply gives us a level of confidence. A different explanation for the existence of fossils could be that a scientist synthesized fossil materials in a lab and buried them to eventually claim fame once he/she later 'discovers' them and proposes a breakthrough theory of dinosaurs. However, there are sound reasons that easily disprove this explanation, namely, there is no evidence of a scientist or lab in 1677 (when Robert Plot found the first fossil) that had the capability to synthesize an organic material that could resemble the form of a fossil.

![The Gettier Problem (philosophy), GÃ¶delâ€™s Incompleteness Theorems (math), and Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle (science)Â all arrive at the same idea from different disciplines -- proof requires complete information and infinite precision. Conjecture is imminent (we settle for "beyond a reasonable doubt" in court.)](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/proof.png)

Evidence is an empirical starting point. It exists in context. A thorough assessment of evidence addresses as much context as possible. At the same time, there will always be missing context, so we will never have a totally complete or perfectly accurate history. I call this *The* *Theory of Relative History*.

### Explanations

I once concluded that everything can be explained, so the world must be deterministic. I arrived at this conclusion after reading *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.amazon.com/Beginning-Infinity-Explanations-Transform-World/dp/0143121359)* by David Deutsch. I highly recommend reading it. In fact, it was the inspiration for this blog (if you donâ€™t read books, then at least listen to Naval Ravikantâ€™s *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEmJIA0pEf0)* podcast series with Brett Hall breaking down the book). The big takeaway from the book is that omniscience is not required to have â€˜creativityâ€™ -- an ability to create new â€œthingsâ€. You do not need to know absolutely every fact that exists in order to understand everything that can be understood. Reality is most accurately described using good explanations, and there is an explanation for everything. The building blocks of explanations are **[First Principles](https://fs.blog/first-principles/#_ftn11)** -- namely the foundations of science (Relativity, Quantum, Evolution, Information, Computing, etc.) -- and the fuel is imagination.

> *â€œWhat I cannot create, I do not understandâ€*
>
> \-- Richard Feynman

Science is an error-correcting machine. It disproves explanations and forms better ones. You will find that the most impactful explanations require intense imagination because they describe â€˜the seenâ€™ in terms of â€˜the unseenâ€™. In other words, they describe things that cannot be observed. Unseen phenomena can be measured with special equipment, but we just observe the measurement readings on the equipment. For example, we can measure the temperature of an atomâ€™s nucleus, but we cannot observe the movement of quarks which are the cause (we think) of the temperature reading that we observe. An explanation is not an explanation unless it is testable, falsifiable, and precisely describes a significant mechanism of change (cause and effect). It is our best guess. In this way, even good explanations are at risk of being inaccurate. This is okay because this is how we create new knowledge. A good explanation is our best understanding, our best description for how something works, at any given time. It is like the scientific method on steroids. A good explanation provides reasons and digs deep. It asks questions to get to the root. Try the **5 Whyâ€™s method** to improve the accuracy of an explanation.

> *â€œScience is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.â€*
>
> â€” Carl Sagan

As you can see from the bike example at the beginning, an explanation does not need to be entirely complete in order to be valuable because intelligent beings (humans) can identify patterns and make inferences. Again, a partially true, incomplete explanation can be sufficient if we only care about a certain level of accuracy. An explanation is measured by its explanatory power -- the degree to which an explanation accomplishes an objective. The objective can be to accurately describe Truth. Explanations have degrees of completeness based on the amount of information present in them\*\*\*\*. A thorough explanation leaves little to chance. A complete explanation leaves nothing to chance. The pinnacle of explanations is a perfect explanation -- 100% complete and 100% accurate. The ultimate explanation, a *Theory of Everything*, would be perfect. Many people have tried to find this explanation, such as Michio Kaku's *[The God Equation](https://www.amazon.com/God-Equation-Quest-Theory-Everything/dp/0385542747)* (I have not read yet), but none have succeeded.

The jury is still out on if a perfect explanation exists.

### Truth

Our initial guess for how knowledge exists is known as the â€˜justified true beliefâ€™ theory of knowledge. This theory says that knowledge is about justifying your beliefs as true. It then goes on to say that if you accomplish this, then your belief is knowledge. This a misconception because there is no logical way to prove any bit of knowledge as Truth (with a capital â€˜Tâ€™). One can provide evidence, but this is not proof. If an explanation prevails against attempts to disprove it, then it is consistent with reality and is probably considered useful. Yet, we can never know with 100% certainty that the explanation accurately describes a fundamental Truth (a â€œlawâ€ of nature\*\*\*\*\*) because there is always a chance that we discover new knowledge debunking that explanation. Then, we simply come up with a better explanation.

The first step to finding truth is to develop a theory of knowledge (epistemology). I subscribe to the theory that knowledge is an interpretation of information that is accepted as truth and can be measured for accuracy and significance. This implies knowledge is subjective i.e. your truth may not be my truth.

The important thing here is that reality is not intrinsically random or uncertain â€¦ with one theoretical exception. The only proposed natural randomness in the universe is the phenomena described by quantum mechanics -- an explanation for how matter and energy behaves as spacetime approaches zero. Even in quantum, we have some predictive ability of the probability distribution of subatomic particles in spacetime. This gets more interesting if you consider quantum randomness in a multiplicative series of moments. ---

Personal wealth is now more accessible than ever. Itâ€™s easier than ever to start investing, and it costs less than ever to do so as well. The internet has made it possible to invest in stock market directly from your desk and get started with little or no money. However, the way we think about wealth has changed too. It used to be about reaching the top of the financial hill and staying there for as long as possible. Today that approach doesnâ€™t work anymore. Instead of focusing on a single goal, we need to look at new ways to generate income, increase our spending power and build wealth for the future. Wealth is no longer just about having money in reserve for old age; instead it should be used as a tool for enhancing our lives today and tomorrow. The new generation of rich people is those who have flexibility in their careers and can enjoy ample time off from work; they are also those who know how to save money while spending on the things they truly value â€” like education or travel, or cryptocurrency ğŸ˜‰ â€” so they can relax when they retire.

## Create a new financial identity

As you grow your wealth, youâ€™ll want to create a new financial identity. Itâ€™s the idea of having separate accounts for each asset type to help you better understand your wealth. For example, you might want to create an investment account, a savings account, and a retirement account. This way, you can better track your spending and investing behavior. You can also keep your spending under control and avoid unintentionally overspending by only having a single credit card.

In the current great correction of the market, people realized the old method of the investment may no longer work since the higher the inflation with lower the growth potential. You need a new way to generate wealth in a creative yet low-risk way.

## Be proactive in saving for the future

While itâ€™s OK not to have a specific amount to set aside each month, many people fail to live up to their potential. Remember: the earlier you start saving for retirement, the more you can increase your monthly retirement income. Moreover, the earlier you start saving, the less you risk running out of money during retirement. If you are currently earning a low income, you should put aside as much as you can each month, as high savings rates now can translate into a higher monthly income in retirement. Also, you can find alternative ways to test the new ideas about future finance, including cryptocurrency.

## Invest for the long term and use liquid assets to grow your wealth

When it comes to investing, the earlier the better. This can mean starting young, and investing your spare change. Once you get the hang of it and understand the basic principles, it gets easier. The earlier you start, the better. Especially if you have spare change. Invest in stocks, and crypto such as Bitcoin and Ethereum. With Bitcoin and Ethereum, you can expect a long-term return. A long-term investment strategy is also a good way to grow your wealth over time. You can also use liquid assets to get the biggest bang for your buck. For example, you can use a savings or investment account to withdraw money to cover monthly expenses, then write the transaction off taxes-free. You donâ€™t want to tie up all your wealth in one investment that might not pay off for years. Also, try to minimize your sending and taking more loans with higher interest payments.

## Donâ€™t forget about insurance: protect your current and future wealth

If youâ€™re planning to retire, it helps to understand how much money youâ€™ll need to live comfortably in your retirement years. This is known as your retirement savings goal (RSG). The first step is to calculate your likely annual expenses. This may include: housing payments, food, transportation, insurance, other necessities, and perhaps some travel too. Then, you need to add in your monthly expenses like transportation and health care. Finally, you can add in other important costs like retirement savings, annual vacation, and some discretionary spending money. Once you have a good idea of your current financial situation and your likely expenses in retirement, you can create a retirement savings goal and adjust the goal if necessary. Having a retirement savings goal and an insurance plan will help protect your current wealth and ensure you have enough savings for future generations.

## Bottom line

While itâ€™s important to celebrate the present, itâ€™s also important to consider the future. You must never forget where youâ€™ve come from and how far youâ€™ve come. This is how youâ€™ll be able to enjoy the prosperity of the new generation of rich people.Â

title: Exploring the uncharted jungles of Web3, a personal story.
body:
![DALLÂ·E AI-generated image of a hexagonal gateway to a sci-fi jungle with neon light streaks](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*MJHc4p_La5DNBt4d0n9TlA.png)

Itâ€™s a messy and confusing place.

So much jargon and technicality that Iâ€™m not surprised why people avoid it or think itâ€™s a scam. I did too.

Hereâ€™s my story cutting down some vines, turning back a couple of times, and finally set on exploring this jungle of Web3.

![DALLÂ·E AI-generated image of a sci-fi jungle city with neon light streaks, platform and buildings, view no.1](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*_tQzjNb0f4s29gO3XhbDLA.png)

## Part 1: The Awareness

I first heard about blockchain, crypto, and Bitcoin in 2017. It was this revolutionary technology that would change the world or so it seemed.

Blockchain companies were popping up left and right; but it was just whitepapers, initial coin offerings (ICO), and expensive mining rigs â€” no actual implementations.

But I still invited one to present in a forum I organized. I wanted the company I worked for, to not stay stagnant. Well hopefully, the applications of blockchain would spark some ideas, right?

Nope, sadly I later realized that most corporate companies are heavily risk-averse. They preach a lot about innovation and change but continue to act with a legacy and conservative mindset.

I wanted to pursue it further but I didnâ€™t have much, know where to buy, or even how to mine. And so I left it behind then.

![DALLÂ·E AI-generated image of a sci-fi jungle city with neon light streaks, platform and buildings, view no.2](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*mOL56p0Qq1SGehvb0BIVBg.png)

I focused on learning about more accessible technologies and personal finance as Iâ€™m still a novice compared to my peers.

Crypto was something I still felt was too speculative.

Where do you even spend it? I could count the number of merchants who accepted it in my country with my fingers.

The pandemic hit and well, cash is king.

![DALLÂ·E AI-generated image of a sci-fi jungle city with neon light streaks, platform and buildings, view no.3](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*ShN3qK9T8uyp2lobuAfz-Q.png)

## Part 2: The Impulsive FOMO

2021 arrived and pandemic restrictions became more relaxed.

Bitcoin and Ethereum are huge household names. More crypto companies exist and with much better UI UX, although still not friendly.

But I still could not understand why prices go up or down, I sort of still donâ€™t.

A part of me regrets that I could have those juicy profits like other people.

Blindly, I decided to invest some. Welp, it was near its *ALL-TIME HIGH*.

Such a terrible decision hahaha. I decided to leave the coins in the exchange and forget about them until I can cover up my losses, or so I thought.

![DALLÂ·E AI-generated image of a window to the sci-fi jungle city](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*CEEZE5OdbLKai3iA8pPPFg.png)

## Part 3: The Enlightenment

I switched jobs in 2022 to pursue a career goal: transforming old traditional companies. Some had been lost due to the pandemic and their inability to keep up with the times.

So I look for new ways of getting revenue. While doing research, NFTs (non-fungible tokens) and their insane prices headlined the news. Since they are just JPEGs, surely I can make money, right?

![DALLÂ·E AI-generated image of a lake with platforms to walk on in the sci-fi jungle city](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*SoKqf_zaa32SrJLlSTs3Iw.png)

Well, that was my rabbit hole to Web3.

I got to know briefly what the culture and community are like, what are corporates doing, how does it work, what new applications are there, what really are NFTs, etc.

DeFi (decentralized finance) was something I was drawn to. I can finally earn something with the dumb coins I invested in. Not much but hey, better than nothing.

I am a believer in this tech/movementâ€™s larger picture â€” new ways of earning income, financial instruments without a bank account or credit history, communities of things people like or want to accomplish, and many others.

Itâ€™s a whole jungle out there and someone needs help clearing a path.

That may be just you and me. **Welcome to Web3.**


---

Apfel is a product/project /marketer based in SEA and a Web3 newbie. He spends his timeâ€”playing with his pets, at the gym, lazing in bed, or at his Web2 job he wishes to leave. Check Apfel out on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Apfel_eth) or [Lens](https://lensfrens.xyz/apfel.lens).

PS: Apfel is looking for a job in Web3, teehee!

Disclaimer: All images were created using Dall-E.

![DALLÂ·E AI-generated image of a human male exploring the uncharted areas of the sci-fi jungle city](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*RamBGczVRMegm1uNIDSdPg.png)

title: Apple AirPods Pro 2: Design of next-generation premium earbuds leaks with a revised charging case
body:
[52audio](https://www.52audio.com/archives/123351.html)Â has shared images of the AirPods Pro 2, the long-rumoured replacements for the AirPods Pro that Apple released in 2019. Previously,Â [52audio](https://www.52audio.com/archives/123351.html)Â accurately leaked photos of the AirPods 3, as well as providing first looks at the original AirPods Pro three years ago. As far as we can tell, these images are marketing renders, or third-party CAD renders based on a leaked design.

Regardless, the images match the hands-on images leaked by MacRumors in October 2021. As such, the AirPods Pro 2 resemble the AirPods Pro, albeit with minor changes. Specifically, the earbuds retain the stem design of the AirPods Pro but with new sensors to detect when you have removed the earbuds from your ears. Purportedly, the AirPods Pro 2 will support the ALAC and [LC3 codecs](https://www.notebookcheck.net/Apple-could-address-shortcomings-of-the-AirPods-3-AirPods-Pro-and-AirPods-Max-with-future-update.631469.0.html), which should deliver higher audio fidelity while reducing power consumption compared to the AAC and SBC that the original AirPods Pro supports.

**Working For Notebookcheck** 
 Are you a techie who knows how to write? Then join our Team! 
 [Details here](https://www.notebookcheck.net/Jobs.2095.0.html#c92382)

*(Image source: 52audio)*

*(Image source: 52audio)*

**Survey** 
 Join our Support Satisfaction Survey 2022: We want to hear about your experiences! 
 [Participate here](https://www.notebookcheck.net/Survey-Laptop-and-Smartphone-Service-and-Support-Satisfaction-2022.606961.0.html)

Meanwhile, 52audio's leaked images underline that Apple will overhaul the AirPods Pro's charging case with the second-generation model. For one, the website claims that Apple will adopt a USB Type-C charging port, whichÂ [9to5Mac](https://9to5mac.com/2022/06/24/airpods-pro-2-case/)Â doubts is the case. Instead, the latter asserts that all AirPods products will continue to utilise the Lightning connector until after Apple releases the iPhone 15 series in 2025.

As it stands, Apple is expected to announce the AirPods Pro 2 at a launch event alongside the iPhone 14 series and theÂ [Watch Series 8](https://www.notebookcheck.net/Apple-Watch-Series-8-New-render-images-emerge-in-what-could-also-be-the-Apple-Watch-Extreme-Edition.620838.0.html). Currently, Apple is rumoured to have scheduled an event for September 13, during which it could also present theÂ [Watch Extreme Edition](https://www.notebookcheck.net/Leaker-shares-details-about-Apple-September-hardware-event-with-iPhone-14-Pro-Apple-Watch-Extreme-Edition-and-Apple-M2-showcase.620100.0.html).

title: Ownership - cryptocurrency market vs stock market
body:
## The most fundamental difference is what you buy.

Stocks represent a percentage of ownership (or capital) in a company.  When you buy stocks on the stock exchange, you own the portion of the traded company.  This naturally gives you some rights, such as voting rights.

On the other hand, when you buy a cryptocurrency, you only own the token and the value of the digital asset.  It will not give you the property rights to the crypto coin making company.  However, there are thousands of crypto coins, each designed to meet a specific need - some, such as Bitcoin, are now a digital commodity, as is gold, many others are designed to be used in specific operations.

It is recommended that you do a basic layer of research to understand the ecosystem before choosing the coins you want to invest in.

### Value - digital currencies vs.  stock market shares

In stocks, the value is based on the physical firm, and the returns or value of the stocks depend on the performance and development of the company whose stocks you own.  The share price rises and falls based on forecasts for the company's future success.

Cryptocurrency is not backed by any hard assets as, as a digital asset, its value depends on supply and demand as well as market sentiment.
